Module roborally
Package client.view

Class PlayerMatController

java.lang.Object
client.view.Controller
client.view.PlayerMatController
public class PlayerMatController
extends Controller
This class represents the playerMat of the player, it contains the registers where the player has to place programming cards and also information about name, figure, energy, checkpoints, discard deck count and programming deck count.
Author:
sarah, annika

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private boolean againNotFirst
    This stores if the player wants to drop an Again Card into the first register.
    private javafx.scene.layout.HBox checkPointsHBox
    This HBox will contain Images of the checkPoints the player visited.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label discardDeckLabel
    This Label displays the count of the amount of cards in the discard deck.
    private int discardDeckNr  
    private javafx.scene.image.ImageView droppedImageView
    This Image stores the ImageView that got dropped and gets added to the pane of the register.

    This Image stores the Image of one energy cube.

    This HBox shows the energy tokens of the player.

    This HBox shows the energy tokens of the player.

    The height of the register places.

    The playerIcon displays the figure of the player.

    This Pane contains everything according to the playerMat.

    This Label shows the name of the player.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label playerMatInfoLabel
    This Label shows the information that Again card is not allowed in the first register, it gets displayed if someone tries that.
    private int positionDroppedCard
    This stores the position of the former register the card was to check which instruction should get send to server.

    This Label displays the count of the amount of cards in the programming deck.

    This HBox displays the images that get dragged and dropped into its children.
    private javafx.scene.layout.HBox registerHBoxBackground
    This HBox is behind the HBox that contains all registers and displays default images.
    private double widthRegisterCard
    The width of the register places.

      private javafx.scene.layout.HBox energyHBox2
      This HBox shows the energy tokens of the player. It represents the second row, if the player gets a lot energy tokens.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This method initializes the layout elements, creates them and adds energy.

    • loadPlayerMap

      public void loadPlayerMap​(Player player)
      This method gets called when the player gets added. It sets the figure and the name of the player.
      Parameters:
      player - the player with his id, name etc.

    • setSpacingHBoxes

      private void setSpacingHBoxes()
      This method sets spacing to HBoxes according to energy and the registerHBoxes

    • addDropHandling

      private void addDropHandling​(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
      This method adds EventHandler to a pane by dragging over it, drag exited and drag done.
      Parameters:
      pane - the pane that should get EventHandler

    • setOnDragOver

      private void setOnDragOver​(javafx.scene.input.DragEvent e, javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
      This method gets called by dragging over a pane. It checks if the drag is allowed and looks if the player tries to drop an Again card into the first register.
      Parameters:
      e - The DragEvent occurs by dragging over the pane
      pane - the pane that triggers the event

    • checkDragAllowed

      private boolean checkDragAllowed​(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane, javafx.scene.input.Dragboard db)
      This method checks if dragging the image is allowed on a pane.

      If this is allowed depends on the facts if the DragBoard has the right DataFormat, if the ImageView that stores the dragged image is not null, that the former parent isn't the pane and that the pane is empty.

      Parameters:
      pane - the pane that should be the aim for dragging and dropping the imageView
      db - the DragBoard of the dragged event
      Returns:
      it returns if dragging the image is allowed

    • setOnDragExited

      private void setOnDragExited​(javafx.scene.input.DragEvent e, javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
      This method adds (if it's allowed to drag and not again in the first register) the dropped image to the pane and removes it from its former parent. Also it adds again EventHandlers to that ImageView for the next tryout of dragging and dropping.
      Parameters:
      e - The DragEvent occurs when the drag get exited
      pane - the pane that triggers the event

    • setOnDragDone

      private void setOnDragDone()
      This method handles the card and send the protocol SelectCard with null and the former position if it was in a register. And additional it checks if the card was a damage card, then it handles the count of the related deck. If everything went correct it sends the protocol SelectCard with the card and the register.

    • createImageView

      private javafx.scene.image.ImageView createImageView​(javafx.scene.image.ImageView programmingCardImageView, int position)
      This method adds an EventHandler to an ImageView which creates a DragBoard with DataFormat and sets information about the dragged imageView in the parent class.
      Parameters:
      programmingCardImageView - the imageView that should get EventHandler
      position - the position if the imageView in the registers
      Returns:
      the imageView that has now an EventHandler

    • reset

      public void reset()
      This method resets all elements and information that get changed during the programming phase. It empties the registers and creates them again.

    • addImage

      private void addImage​(java.lang.String path, javafx.scene.layout.StackPane pane)
      This method generates an ImageView and adds it to a pane
      Parameters:
      path - the path of an image that should get added to an ImageView
      pane - the Pane which should get a ImageView

    • setNewCardsYouGotNow

      public void setNewCardsYouGotNow​(CardsYouGotNow cardsYouGotNow)
      This method sets cards if the player didn't fill the registers in time. The images of those cards get added to the registerHBox.
      Parameters:
      cardsYouGotNow - the list of new cards

    • fixSelectedCards

      public void fixSelectedCards()
      This method fixes the 5 in the programming phase selected programming cards. To achieve this it adds the images of cards to the registerHBoxBackground and removes them from the registerHBox.

    • createRegisterNumberImages

      private void createRegisterNumberImages()
      This method creates the number information of the 5 registers and adds them to the playerMat.

    • createRegisters

      private void createRegisters()
      This method creates the 5 registers and adds 5 panes with EventHandlers to the registerHBox.

    • createRegisterBackground

      private void createRegisterBackground()
      This method creates the 5 background registers and adds 5 panes with default images to the registerHBoxBackground.

    • checkPointReached

      public void checkPointReached​(int number)
      This method adds an image to the playerMat if the player gets a new checkpoint. Depending on the count of checkpoint he has the size of images get changed.
      Parameters:
      number - the number of the new checkpoint

    • addEnergy

      public void addEnergy​(int count)
      This method adds an image to the playerMat if the player gets an amount of energy. Depending on the count of energy he has the size of images get changed.
      Parameters:
      count - the count of new energy

    • setDiscardDeckCounter

      public void setDiscardDeckCounter​(int amount)
      Sets the number of the Discard Deck. If the amount is 0, the number is reset to 0. Otherwise, the amount is added to the current number.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount of cards that gets added

    • setProgrammingDeckCounter

      public void setProgrammingDeckCounter​(int amount)
      Sets the number of the Programming Deck. If the amount is equal to the player cards, the number is reset. Otherwise, the amount is subtracted from the current number.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount of cards that gets added

    • resetDeckCounter

      public void resetDeckCounter​(int amount)
      Checks if the number of the programming deck is smaller than the amount to be subtracted, if so, the deck is reset and then the amount is subtracted. Otherwise, the amount is subtracted from the deck.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to be subtracted

    • addPlayerCards

      public void addPlayerCards​(int amount)
      The playerCards are increased by the amount.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount of cards that gets added

    • subtractPlayerCards

      public void subtractPlayerCards​(int amount)
      The playerCards are decreased by the amount.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount of cards that gets subtracted

    • getPlayerCards

      public int getPlayerCards()

    • getProgrammingDeckNr

      public int getProgrammingDeckNr()
